description: An underwater island located 10,000 meters below sea level, serving as the gateway to the New World. It is home to fish-men and merfolk and is surrounded by a giant double-layered bubble.

keyEvents.title: Saved from Destruction by Sea Kings
keyEvents.description: Fish-Man Island is saved from being destroyed by Noah when Shirahoshi commands the Sea Kings to stop the massive ship.
keyEvents.significance: The island is preserved, preventing a catastrophic disaster and allowing its inhabitants to continue their lives. This marks the successful resolution of the Fish-Man Island Arc's main conflict.

keyEvents.title: Blood Donation Law Revealed
keyEvents.description: The discriminatory law forbidding cross-species blood transfusions is exposed as one of Fish-Man Island's deep-seated prejudices.
keyEvents.significance: Highlights the ongoing struggle with prejudice on Fish-Man Island despite efforts by Queen Otohime and Fisher Tiger to create harmony.

keyEvents.title: Discriminatory Law Defied by Jinbe
keyEvents.description: Jinbe breaks Fish-Man Island's blood donation law by donating blood to Luffy, marking a significant step toward overcoming prejudice.
keyEvents.significance: Represents progress toward the equality and harmony that Queen Otohime dreamed of, showing that change is possible through individual acts of courage.

statusHistory.reason: Island saved from destruction and continues to thrive

description: A massive ship located on Fish-Man Island, said to be half the size of the island itself. It was built during the Void Century with a mysterious purpose tied to a promise made by Joy Boy.

keyEvents.title: Noah Stopped and Moved by Sea Kings
keyEvents.description: The Sea Kings respond to Shirahoshi's command and stop Noah from destroying Fish-Man Island, then carefully move it to the Sea Forest for future repair.
keyEvents.significance: Preserves Noah for its intended purpose, which is tied to an ancient promise made 800 years ago between Joy Boy and the previous Poseidon.

keyEvents.title: Sea Kings Discuss Noah's True Purpose
keyEvents.description: While moving Noah, the Sea Kings reveal that 800 years ago they promised to use Noah for an important mission with Joy Boy and Poseidon, but the promise was never fulfilled.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Noah as a key element in ancient history and suggests it will play a crucial role in the series' endgame when the promise is finally kept.

statusHistory.reason: Noah was damaged during Luffy's battle with Hordy Jones and requires repair before it can fulfill its purpose

description: A coral forest located on the seafloor near Fish-Man Island, containing a graveyard for ships and serving as the resting place for Queen Otohime and various historical artifacts.

keyEvents.title: Noah Moved to Sea Forest
keyEvents.description: The Sea Kings carefully transport the damaged Noah to the Sea Forest, where it can rest until it can be repaired for its future purpose.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the Sea Forest as Noah's resting place, symbolically connecting it to the legacy of Queen Otohime and Fisher Tiger who also have ties to this location.

statusHistory.reason: Continues to serve as a significant location for Fish-Man Island history

description: The royal palace of Fish-Man Island where King Neptune and his family reside. It is a grand underwater palace that serves as the seat of government for the Ryugu Kingdom.

keyEvents.title: Palace Treasures Exchanged for Mermaids
keyEvents.description: Neptune reveals that palace treasures were given to kidnappers in exchange for the safe return of the captured mermaids.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates Neptune's values as a leader who prioritizes his people's lives over material wealth.

keyEvents.title: Site of Luffy's Treatment
keyEvents.description: Luffy receives emergency medical treatment at Ryugu Palace after his battle with Hordy Jones, where the issue of blood transfusion arises.
keyEvents.significance: The palace becomes the setting for the episode's central conflict regarding discriminatory blood donation laws.

statusHistory.reason: Palace continues to function as the royal residence and government center
